newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa Gauteng board invites casino licence bids.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa Gauteng board invites casino licence bids.

text.p: South Africa's Gauteng gambling and betting board said on Thursday it was inviting bids from interested parties to apply for a maximum of six casino licences in the province.
It said in a statement that application documentation will be available from April 2. The closing date for submissions will be June 17, 1997.

The board said it was unable at this stage to forecast realistic dates for the granting of the licences, but would make an announcement in this regard as soon as applications had been received and assessed.
"All things being equal, however, the casino licences should be granted before the end of the year," it said.
Gauteng is South Africa's second province to open bids for licences. Mpumalanga, in the east of the country, in January announced the preferred bidders for three casino operations.
Casino gambling was legalised in South Africa for the first time last year and provinces have been given the power to award the licences.
